title: Search for sbottom and stop with the ATLAS detector at the LHC
abstractText: See Sussex EPP 2012 consolidated grant submission
impactText: The exclusion limits obtained are used by theory particle physicists and cosmologists to constrain models of Supersymmetry Education,Other
findingsText: The main branch of research was devoted to the search of the supersymmetric partner of the top quark. These new particles have not been found, hence exclusion limits have been set on the masses of these particles.These are among the strongest existing limits worldwide. These exclusion limits are used by both theorists and experimentalists to test the predictions of several SUSY models. The constraints set by my work together with other ATLAS colleagues are among the most stringent. Education,Other
